segments.text: I notice the garden outside the window looks so calm and tidy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's such a contrast to the chaos inside the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The path and the low bushes look so inviting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could step outside and enjoy that peaceful scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But instead, I'm stuck watching this mess unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out of the sink, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so focused on her dishes, and the kids are about to cause trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to shout and tell them to look around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But they're all in their own little worlds, not noticing the chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like they're completely blind to what's happening.
segments.speaker: PAR
